Title:
International Components for Unicode: User-assisted execution of
    arbitrary code
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow in International Components for Unicode could
    result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

Background.Text: International Components for Unicode (ICU) is a set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications.

Description.Text: An error in the _canonicalize() function in uloc.cpp could cause a stack-based buffer overflow.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted locale representation using an application linked against ICU, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All ICU users should upgrade to the latest version:
